english: upright; central; name honoring Chiang Kai-shek

etymology.description: 中正(中正) (zhōngzhèng, "upright; central") consists of 中(中) (zhōng, "central; middle") and 正(正) (zhèng, "upright; correct").
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 中(中) (zhōng, "central; middle") and 正(正) (zhèng, "upright; correct") conveys a sense of being upright and correct, centrally aligning with a balanced and impartial position. The word is also notably used as an honorific name for Chiang Kai-shek, reflecting ideals of righteousness and centrality.

examples.chinese: 他为人中正(他為人中正)，赢得众人尊敬(贏得眾人尊敬)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wéirén zhōngzhèng, yíngdé zhòngrén zūnjìng.
examples.english: He is upright, and wins the respect of everyone.

examples.chinese: 他的名字中正(他的名字中正)，寓意正直(寓意正直)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de míngzì zhōngzhèng, yùyì zhèngzhí.
examples.english: His name is Zhongzheng, which implies uprightness.

examples.chinese: 中正曾担任要职(中正曾擔任要職)，被誉为国家栋梁(被譽為國家棟樑)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngzhèng céng dānrèn yàozhí, bèi yù wéi guójiā dòngliáng.
examples.english: Zhongzheng once held an important position and was regarded as a pillar of the nation.
